item.title: The preparation of the springbok's ears
item.summary: The Bushman drum, and dancing-rattles. Mode of preparation of the latter, by the women. By /han≠kass’o, (L VIII.-1. 6127-6137). The springbok's ear dancing rattles are made from dried springbok's ear skin with berries sewn inside.
item.comments: 1) p.6134v: the ||kerri plant: what it looks like, what it is used for and how it is eaten and cooked by people, 2) see also How the prepared springbok's ears are tied on and The preparation of the drum; ears of springbok are tied to the feet of the men who dance and The use of the !goin-!goin, followed by an account of a Bushman dance, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-1
